room.name: Cracking the Caesar Shift with a Partial Solution

scripts.comment: Edit the block on the left to view the problem!

This block can be used to easily crack the Caesar shift assuming you have a "partial solution" (in other words, if you know part of the message). For example, if you know that a message starts with the letter "W", you can easily decode it as shown below!

What if this was using a Vigenere cipher instead? Could you update this to crack a message encrypted using Vigenere (assuming your partial solution text is longer than the key!)? What would happen if your partial solution was shorter than the key?

event.arg: <comment collabId="item_25" x="279" y="88.83333333333331" w="90" collapsed="false">add comment here...</comment>
Edit the block on the left to view the problem!
<comment collabId="item_37" x="69" y="190.83333333333331" w="90" collapsed="false">add comment here...</comment>

This block can be used to easily crack the Caesar shift assuming you have a "partial solution" (in other words, if you know part of the message).
For example, if I know that a message starts with the letter "s", I can easily decode it as shown below!
